The current tenure of Bakhshi was until October 3, 2023. Bakhshi's reappointment will be subject to the approval of the RBI and the shareholders of the bank.

177.title: 306 madrassas, including Darul Uloom, declared illegal in UP’s Saharanpur
177.article_body: The Saharanpur administration has declared 306 Islamic educational institutions as illegal, including Deoband's Darul Uloom, after a survey was conducted by the authorities. "An investigation was [conducted] on the basis of parameters set by the administration like the year of establishment of the madrassa, the society that runs it...and their source of income," an officer said.

178.title: Police seize ₹63 lakh hawala money in Hyderabad, 5 arrested
178.article_body: The Commissioner’s Task Force, in coordination with the Central Zone Police, busted a hawala racket on Sunday in Hyderabad's Troop Bazar and arrested five persons. The police seized cash worth ₹63,50,000 along with a two-wheeler, five mobile phones and a cashier machine. The police caught the accused while raiding an electrical godown at Ranuja Marketing.

179.title: Assam government hikes DA by 4% for employees
179.article_body: Assam Chief Minister Himanta Biswa Sarma, on Twitter, announced an additional dearness allowance (DA) of 4% for all government employees and all India service officers as a festival gift. He said the additional DA will be effective from July 1, and the additional amount will be paid with October's salary. It will increase the DA of the employees to 35%.

180.title: Representation matters: Priyanka on Diwali holiday in NYC schools
180.article_body: Actress Priyanka Chopra has reacted to the news of Diwali being announced as a public school holiday in New York City from 2023 onwards. "After all these years! My teenage self living in Queens is crying tears of joy. Representation matters," she wrote on Instagram. On the work front, Priyanka's next Bollywood project is 'Jee Le Zaraa'.

181.title: Adopt stray dogs, take them home if you want to feed them: Bombay HC
181.article_body: Bombay High Court's Nagpur Bench has said, "If any person is interested in feeding stray dogs, he shall first adopt the stray dog/bitch, bring it to home, register it with Municipal Authorities or put it in some dogs shelter." It also directed Nagpur civic body to impose up to ₹200 fine on people feeding stray dogs in public places.

182.title: Mandy Moore welcomes second child with husband Taylor, shares pics
182.article_body: Actress Mandy Moore and her husband Taylor Goldsmith welcomed their second child. On October 22, Moore shared some pictures on Instagram and introduced her newborn baby boy as Oscar Bennett Goldsmith. "Our hearts have doubled in size and the immediacy of the love is astounding. He is beyond words and we're so grateful for our family of four," she wrote.

183.title: New data transmission record set using a single light source
183.article_body: An international group of researchers from the Technical University of Denmark (DTU) and the Chalmers University of Technology in Gothenburg, Sweden have set a new data transmission record of 1.8 petabits per second. The record data transmission speed was achieved using only a single laser and an optical chip. Notably, 1 petabit corresponds to 1 million gigabits.

184.title: Student run over by bus at Bangalore University succumbs to injuries
184.article_body: The 23-year-old student, who was run over by a Bengaluru Metropolitan Transport Corporation bus at Bangalore University's Jnana Bharati campus, has succumbed to her injuries, 13 days after the accident. She had slipped while boarding the bus and was crushed under its rear wheel on October 10. Following the accident, students blocked the campus' gates and prevented vehicles from entering.

185.title: Plane carrying Gold's Gym owner & family crashes near Costa Rica; all 6 feared dead
185.article_body: A plane carrying businessman Rainer Schaller, who owns fitness and gym outlets like Gold's Gym and McFit, crashed into the Caribbean just off the Costa Rican coast. Piloted by a Swiss national, Schaller was travelling with his partner, Christiane Schikorsky, their two children and a fitness trainer. According to authorities, all six people are feared dead.

186.title: Ferrari hits railing on Mumbai's Bandra-Worli Sea Link; no one hurt
186.article_body: A speeding Ferrari rammed into the railing on the Bandra-Worli Sea Link in Mumbai, police said. The car reportedly belongs to an industrialist. The police added that no one was injured in the incident. "The car was speeding and we suspect it was about to race on the Sea Link but...it veered out of control," a police official said.

187.title: B'luru cab drivers create groups on Telegram to connect with customers
187.article_body: Cab drivers in Bengaluru have created multiple groups on Telegram to stay connected with customers amid ongoing discussions between the Karnataka government and app-based cab aggregators like Ola and Uber. Drivers reportedly add customers they meet on a daily basis to the groups. Customers can ask for a cab in the group and the nearest driver interacts with them directly.

188.title: 2 killed as fire breaks out in Andhra Pradesh cracker shops, video surfaces
188.article_body: Two people were killed after a fire broke out at a cluster of cracker shops in Andhra Pradesh. Police said that the incident took place when the crackers were being unloaded from a van. A video of the burning shops surfaced online. An official statement said that the actual reason behind the fire is being ascertained.

189.title: Rohit Sharma gets emotional during National Anthem ahead of Pakistan match, video viral
189.article_body: Team India captain Rohit Sharma got emotional during the National Anthem ahead of the T20 World Cup 2022 match against Pakistan in Melbourne. A video of the same has gone viral. In the video, Rohit can be seen trying to fight back tears. The ICC also shared the video on Instagram, writing, "The emotions are real!"

190.title: Arshdeep dismisses Babar Azam for golden duck on his first-ever T20 World Cup delivery
190.article_body: Team India fast bowler Arshdeep Singh dismissed Pakistan captain Babar Azam on his first-ever T20 World Cup delivery. The 23-year-old pacer, who is India's youngest member at T20 World Cup 2022, dismissed Babar LBW with an inswinging delivery. Babar opted for a review but the third umpire confirmed his dismissal.

191.title: Cong's Bharat Jodo Yatra enters T'gana after completing its K'taka leg
191.article_body: Congress’ Bharat Jodo Yatra entered Telangana on Sunday after completing its Karnataka leg. Congress leader Rahul Gandhi was accorded a grand welcome at the Telangana-Karnataka border by Telangana Congress leaders. After entering Gudeballur, the yatra halted for a break on the occasion of Diwali. It will resume from there on the morning of October 27.

192.title: Man sitting inside car dies as gas cylinder fitted in vehicle explodes in TN
192.article_body: A person who was sitting inside a car in Tamil Nadu's Coimbatore died after a gas cylinder that was fitted inside the vehicle exploded. The identity of the person is yet to be ascertained. Police said that the process of collecting evidence is on. Security has been tightened in the area following the incident.

193.title: I've switched off TV, doused myself with anti-jinx spray: Mahindra on India-Pak match
193.article_body: Businessman Anand Mahindra said that he has doused himself with "anti-jinx spray" ahead of India-Pakistan's T20 World Cup 2022 match on Sunday. "As always, I am ready for the...match...[I] have my anti-stress ball and worry beads at my side. And my TV set firmly switched off," he tweeted. Mahindra joked that he'll now only wait for news of the result.

194.title: Burn under control now: CEO on report of Unacademy's losses jumping 85% in FY22
194.article_body: Reacting to a report on Unacademy's losses jumping 85% from ₹1,537 crore in FY21 to ₹2,848 crore in FY22 due to high ESOP costs, CEO Gaurav Munjal tweeted, "We spent a lot in FY22 to gain market share. Burn is under control now." Earlier, a report said Unacademy has cut its monthly expenditure to ₹50-60 crore from over ₹200 crore.

195.title: Flying car prototype worth ₹2.5 crore whose sides become wings unveiled in US
195.article_body: American startup Alef Aeronautics has unveiled a flying car prototype costing $300,000 (about ₹2.5 crore). The car features a body that flips on its side to become the wings after lift-off and mesh on its top surface to let air flow through. It can be driven on a regular street and is capable of vertical take off and landing.

196.title: Jennifer Aniston reached out the most: Perry on his substance abuse
196.article_body: Actor Matthew Perry said his 'Friends' co-star Jennifer Aniston had confronted him about his alcohol and drug abuse, and often reached out to him. "She was the one who reached out the most. I'm really grateful to her for that," he said. Perry recalled taking 55 Vicodin a day during 'Friends' and admitted that he "didn't know how to stop".

197.title: Amitabh Bachchan reveals he cut a vein on his left calf, was rushed to hospital
197.article_body: Amitabh Bachchan has said that he was recently rushed to a hospital after he cut a vein on his left calf. "A jutting piece of metal sliced my left calf and managed to cut the vein...the vein when cut spurts out the 'red' uncontrollably," he wrote in his blog. He added that he received stitches to control the bleeding.

198.title: Pak have better quality in death overs: Hogg on T20 WC match vs India
198.article_body: Former Australia spinner Brad Hogg said Pakistan "definitely" have better quality in their bowling department in the death overs in comparison to India, ahead of the T20 World Cup 2022 match between the sides. "When it comes to middle overs, India have better spinners than...Pakistan...They have spinners who can pick up wickets but also nullify the run-rate," added Hogg.

199.title: Congress suspends rape accused Kerala MLA Eldhose Kunnappilly
199.article_body: The Congress in Kerala suspended rape accused MLA Eldhose Kunnappilly for six months. "The explanation provided by him on the allegations was not satisfactory. As a representative of the people, he failed to exercise due diligence," the Kerala Pradesh Congress Committee said. A woman had recently filed a rape and attempt to murder case against him.

200.title: Top marketing officer sexually harasses ex-staffer in Mumbai; booked
200.article_body: The Chief Marketing Officer (CMO) of a leading financial company was booked for allegedly sexually harassing a former female employee in Mumbai. The woman claimed that the accused had also threatened to fire her when she refused his sexual advances, according to police. The woman was reportedly fired after the HR department gave clean chit to the accused in 2020.

201.title: Video of 4 men offering namaz inside train in UP surfaces, Railway police launches probe
201.article_body: A video of four men offering namaz inside a train stationed near the Khadda railway station in Uttar Pradesh’s Kushinagar has surfaced on social media. The video was shared by former BJP MLA from Kushinagar Deeplal Bharati. Meanwhile, the Railway police said it has launched a probe into the matter though no FIR has been filed.

202.title: 70-yr-old retired police officer dies after fire engulfs house in Lucknow
202.article_body: A 70-year-old retired Inspector General (IG) of Police died while his wife and son were injured when a fire broke out in their house in Lucknow’s Indira Nagar on Saturday, police said. The fire broke out on the first floor of retired IG DC Pandey’s residence, trapping him and his family. A detailed probe is underway into the matter.

203.title: Helicopter narrowly misses vehicles on Ukraine road; video surfaces
203.article_body: Ukraine's Defense Ministry has shared a video which shows a helicopter narrowly missing vehicles on a road in the country, with the caption, "Welcome to Ukraine." A Twitter user reacted to the video, saying, "Below the radar has a new meaning," while another user tweeted, "Not your typical way to commute to work, but everyone has a job to do."

204.title: India announce their playing XI for T20 World Cup 2022 match against Pakistan
204.article_body: India captain Rohit Sharma won the toss and elected to field first against Pakistan in their T20 World Cup 2022 Super 12 stage match in Melbourne. India have left out Deepak Hooda, Rishabh Pant, Yuzvendra Chahal and Harshal Patel from the playing XI. Mohammad Shami, Bhuvneshwar Kumar and Arshdeep Singh are the three main fast bowlers in India's playing XI.

205.title: All your pain goes away when you take the field against Pak: Sehwag
205.article_body: Sharing his experience while facing Pakistan, ahead of India's T20 World Cup 2022 match against Pakistan, Virender Sehwag said, "No matter how much pain you're in, it...goes away when you take the field against them." Discussing the T20 World Cup 2022 match between the sides, Sehwag stated, "It's a big ground...Be very sure before sending the ball over the boundary."

206.title: What is India's record against Pakistan in T20I cricket?
206.article_body: India and Pakistan have played 11 T20Is against each other, with India winning eight times, including one through a bowl out. India have lost two of their last three T20I matches against Pakistan, including a 10-wicket defeat in T20 World Cup 2021. The T20 World Cup 2022 match will be India-Pakistan's first encounter against each other in Australia.

207.title: Minister slaps woman, she touches his feet in Karnataka; video surfaces
207.article_body: A video of Karnataka Minister V Somanna slapping a woman in Chamarajanagar district during a public event to distribute land title deeds is being widely shared online. The woman could be seen touching the minister's feet after he slaps her. The woman, Kempamma, came to the venue and claimed the selection process for beneficiaries was rigged.

208.title: Pune court grants Father Vincent Pereira bail in the POCSO case
208.article_body: A Pune court on Friday granted bail to Father Vincent Pereira, who was booked under the Protection of Children from Sexual Offences Act (POCSO) for alleged sexual abuse of a 15-year-old boy. The FIR stated that Father Pereira sexually abused the minor boy while two other prominent members of the church allegedly did not act against him.

209.title: Which Indians have smashed the most number of sixes against Pakistan in T20I cricket?
209.article_body: Among Indians, Yuvraj Singh has slammed the most number of sixes against Pakistan in T20I cricket. He slammed nine maximums in eight innings against Pakistan. He is followed by Virat Kohli (seven), Rohit Sharma (six) and Gautam Gambhir (three). Meanwhile, among Pakistanis, Muhammad Rizwan has slammed the most sixes against India in T20I cricket, with six maximums.

210.title: UP woman raped by stepson, husband's colleagues writes to Prez seeking euthanasia
210.article_body: A 30-year-old woman in Uttar Pradesh, allegedly raped by her stepson and gang-raped by her husband's colleagues, has written a letter to President Droupadi Murmu seeking euthanasia. She wrote, "I've lost all my hope in justice. Despite the court's order, police haven't arrested any of the accused." The woman got married to a 55-year-old farmer, three years after her divorce.

211.title: My father tore govt job letter, started Cycle Agarbathies with ₹4,000: Ranga Rao's son
211.article_body: N Ranga Rao, the Founder of Cycle Brand Agarbathies, started his incense business by borrowing ₹4,000 in 1948 after pawning his wife's jewellery. Ranga Rao applied for a central government job after failing in trading and dairy farming, his son Mohan Rangarao revealed. However, he tore up the appointment letter and pursued his dream of becoming an entrepreneur, he added.

212.title: Odisha family says pet dog died due to negligence, FIR filed against doctor
212.article_body: An FIR was filed against a veterinary doctor after a family alleged that their pet dog Dugu died due to negligence of the doctor in Odisha. The dog died on October 17. The family kept his body for four days, hoping for postmortem to find exact cause of his death. The dog died after being brought home from the hospital.

213.title: Audience holds 'Vande Mataram' flags at RRR's Japan screening, makers react
213.article_body: 'RRR' makers on Saturday shared a video in which the Japanese audience was seen holding flags with 'Vande Mataram' written over them. The makers tweeted, "Proud moment for us to see the Vande Mataram flag in the hands of the Japanese and their love towards India at the screening of 'RRR'." The film had its Japan premiere on October 21.

214.title: No player might've faced such pressure: Ajay Jadeja on India-Pak T20 WC match
214.article_body: Ex-India cricketer Ajay Jadeja said "no player" might have experienced similar pressure as that set to be experienced by players featuring in the T20 World Cup 2022 match between India and Pakistan. "I doubt we will ever witness a larger crowd than this for an India-Pakistan contest," added Ajay. "India are the better side...There is absolutely no doubt," he stated.

215.title: This Pakistani team is very challenging: Rohit ahead of T20 WC 2022 match
215.article_body: Discussing India's T20 World Cup 2022 match against Pakistan, Rohit Sharma said, "This Pakistani team is...very challenging...They've been playing good cricket." "All the Pakistan teams I've played...from 2007 to 2022, they've been...good teams," added Rohit. Sharing his approach for the match, Rohit stated, "When we enter the ground...I'll be focused on...[putting] the opposition under pressure."

216.title: Pakistan have the best bowling attack in T20 World Cup 2022: Gambhir
216.article_body: Gautam Gambhir said Pakistan have the "best" bowling attack in T20 World Cup 2022. "If you look at Australia, they've just one bowler who can bowl over 140 kmph. For England, Mark Wood can bowl over 150 kmph," added Gambhir. "For Pakistan, Shaheen Afridi, Haris Rauf and Naseem Shah...can bowl over 140 kmph. Fast bowling is their strength," he stated.

217.title: US girl steals $13,500 from grandmother, gives it to classmates
217.article_body: A 14-year-old girl is facing a grand theft charge after she allegedly stole $13,500 from her grandmother's safe and handed out over $10,000 to her classmates in US' Florida. Officials have recovered about $2,500 from the girl's backpack and around $700 from other students at her school. The arrest report does not mention the reason behind the incident.

218.title: Pakistan have the best bowling in T20 World Cup 2022: Gambhir
218.article_body: Gautam Gambhir said Pakistan have the "best" bowling in T20 World Cup 2022. "If you look at Australia, they have just one bowler who can bowl over 140 kmph. For England, Mark Wood can bowl over 150 kmph," added Gambhir. "For Pakistan, Shaheen Afridi, Haris Rauf and Naseem Shah...can bowl over 140 kmph. Fast bowling is their strength," he stated.

219.title: Plane crashes into building in New Hampshire; 2 on board plane dead
219.article_body: Two people who were on board a small plane died after it crashed into a building in Keene in US' New Hampshire, authorities said. Eight people who were living in an apartment building, connected to the building hit by the plane, were evacuated after a fire broke out. The cause of crash remains under investigation, Keene Mayor George Hansel said.

220.title: PM Modi congratulates ISRO on successful launch of 36 OneWeb satellites
220.article_body: Prime Minister Narendra Modi congratulated the Indian Space Research Organisation (ISRO) on the successful launch of its heaviest rocket with 36 OneWeb satellites. "Congratulations...on the successful launch of our heaviest launch vehicle LVM3 with 36 OneWeb satellites...LVM3 exemplifies Atmanirbharta...and enhances India's competitive edge in global commercial launch service market," he tweeted.

221.title: 4 men tie up & gangrape 32-yr-old nurse at health centre in Chhattisgarh, record act
221.article_body: Four men allegedly tied up and gangraped a 32-year-old nurse who was working alone at a health centre in Chhattisgarh's Manendragarh district. The nurse alleged that the accused recorded the assault and threatened to murder her if she went to the police. Police have arrested three of the accused, including a 17-year-old boy.

222.title: PM constantly sought to create new avenues for jobs for youth: Union Minister
222.article_body: Prime Minister Narendra Modi has constantly sought to create new avenues and opportunities for livelihood, income and government jobs for the country’s youth, Union Minister Jitendra Singh said on Saturday. Furthermore, Singh said that right from the beginning, the Prime Minister has given the highest priority to the issues related to the youth.

223.title: Balenciaga, Vogue cut ties with Kanye West over his anti-Semitic comments
223.article_body: Fashion house Balenciaga and fashion magazine Vogue have announced that they'll no longer work with Kanye West. The announcement has come weeks after West's anti-Semitic remarks. "Balenciaga has no longer any relationship nor any plans for future projects related to this artist," the brand's parent company said in a statement. West made his modelling debut at Balenciaga's 2023 show.

224.title: 30-yr-old labourer returning to Bihar dies after cough bout at Pune station
224.article_body: A 30-year-old labourer who was returning to his home in Bihar died after he suffered a bout of cough at Pune Railway Station. The Government Railway Police have denied that the man died during a stampede at the railway station amid a huge rush of people heading home for Diwali. Police said the man was unwell, according to primary investigations.

225.title: Suryakumar Yadav, Babar Azam rate their own skills out of 100
225.article_body: The ICC has shared videos of Team India batter Suryakumar Yadav and Pakistan captain Babar Azam rating their skills out of 100. Suryakumar rated his power 90, stroke range 93, spin-playing skills 95, pace-playing skills 93 and his fielding 90. Meanwhile, Babar rated his power 70, stroke range 80, spin-playing skills 75, pace-playing skills 90 and his fielding 60.

226.title: Actors of 90s like SRK or Aamir still understand story's importance: Ghai
226.article_body: Director Subhash Ghai said that the actors of 90s, such as Shah Rukh Khan, Salman Khan or Aamir Khan, "still understand the importance of" a film's story, but today's generation of actors "wants the money to come first". Ghai said, "They are just bothered about their personal branding and fees; they feel they have become big brands."

227.title: 5 charged after US daycare worker scared kids with Halloween mask
227.article_body: After a video surfaced of a daycare worker scaring children while wearing a Halloween mask in US' Mississippi, four people linked to the video are facing child abuse charges while a fifth person is facing two misdemeanour counts, authorities said. The video showed children crying and running from the masked worker. The owner of the daycare isn't facing any charges.

228.title: US VP Kamala Harris hosts Diwali celebrations in Washington, videos surface
228.article_body: US Vice President Kamala Harris hosted Diwali celebrations at her official residence, the Naval Observatory, on Friday. Some videos that surfaced on social media from the event showed her lighting sparklers along with her husband and Second Gentleman, Doug Emhoff, and wishing each other 'Happy Diwali'. Several prominent Indian Americans were present at the event.

229.title: K'taka Deputy Speaker Anand Mamani passes away at 56, CM pays tribute
229.article_body: The Deputy Speaker of Karnataka, Anand Mamani (56), passed away late Saturday night in the Manipal Hospital in Bengaluru. He was battling ill health for more than a month. Karnataka CM Basavaraj Bommai paid tribute to his party colleague and said, "I pray that God rest his soul in eternal peace and give his family strength to bear this pain."

230.title: Army Chief, his wife visit Army Base Hospital in Delhi
230.article_body: Chief of Army staff General Manoj Pande and his wife Archana Pande visited the Base Hospital, Delhi Cantt on Saturday and interacted with the serving soldiers and their families. He also lauded the efforts of paramedics for ensuring a conducive healthcare ecosystem. He took over as the new Chief of Army Staff from General Manoj Mukund Naravane on April 30.

231.title: 8 drug peddlers transporting 480 kg ganja held: Rachakonda Police
231.article_body: Rachakonda Police tweeted on Saturday that eight inter-state drug peddlers who were transporting 480 kg of ganja were arrested by Hayathnagar police. The accused were transporting ganja, which they would sell for ₹20,000 per kg, from Andhra Pradesh's Visakhapatnam to Hyderabad and Karnataka, the police said. The accused were detained under the Preventive Detention Act, the police added.

232.title: Rohit Sharma dons mic while practising in nets, ICC shares video
232.article_body: The ICC has shared a video of India captain Rohit Sharma practising in the nets while donning a mic. In the video, Rohit can be heard calling Shami "most dangerous" bowler. "You're swinging the ball very late. I can see everything," he was also heard telling a bowler. He was also seen praising Dinesh Karthik for one of his shots.

233.title: Not here to have a nice and easy time or build a 'me too' company: Ola CEO
233.article_body: Ola CEO Bhavish Aggarwal at the company's recent launch event said, "We're not here to build a 'me too' company, we're not here to have a nice and easy time." Addressing allegations of a "hostile" work culture at Ola, Aggarwal said, "We are a very ambitious company." Ola has a culture of high quality and high execution, the 37-year-old added.

234.title: Video shows launch of ISRO's heaviest rocket with 36 satellites on board
234.article_body: OneWeb has shared a video showing the launch of ISRO's heaviest rocket carrying the startup's 36 broadband satellites on board. The LVM3 rocket lifted off from the Sriharikota spaceport just after midnight, marking its first commercial satellite launch. At 1.42 am on Sunday, the ISRO confirmed that the mission was completed successfully, with all 36 satellites placed into intended orbits.

235.title: 4 die, over 40 injured as bus meets with accident on Agra-Lucknow Expressway
235.article_body: Four people were killed while about 42 people were injured after a sleeper bus met with an accident on Agra-Lucknow Expressway. The sleeper bus was en route to Ajmer from Gorakhpur. "While praying for peace for the soul of the departed, the Chief Minister has expressed condolences to the bereaved families," a tweet from the CM Office read.

236.title: India reports 1,994 new COVID-19 cases, active cases stand at 23,432
236.article_body: India reported 1,994 new COVID-19 cases in the last 24 hours, according to the Ministry of Health and Family Welfare. This comes a day after the country recorded 2,112 new COVID-19 cases. The active cases now stand at 23,432. The data showed that 2,601 people recovered in the last 24 hours. The COVID-19 death toll so far has reached 5,28,961.

237.title: Chinese President Xi Jinping secures historic 3rd term in power
237.article_body: Chinese President Xi Jinping has secured a historic third five-year term after he was elected to the Central Committee by the ruling Communist Party on Saturday, making him the nation's most influential leader since founder Mao Zedong. "I wish to thank the whole Party sincerely for the trust you have placed in us," Jinping told journalists on Sunday.

238.title: 27-year-old drug peddler arrested in Hyderabad, 30 gm of MDMA seized
238.article_body: A 27-year-old man, who was allegedly in possession of MDMA, was arrested by the Hyderabad Narcotic Enforcement Wing (H-NEW) in coordination with the Golconda Police. The police seized 30 grams of MDMA, a phone and ₹3,000 cash from the accused, a native of UP. He purportedly purchased psychotropic drugs from dealers and supplied them to consumers in Mumbai and Hyderabad.

239.title: They wouldn't cast me as lead because I'm fat: Maanvi on being body shamed
239.article_body: Actress Maanvi Gagroo opened up about being body shamed in the film industry and said that people didn't want to cast her as the lead of their projects because she was fat. "They didn't know what category to fit me in," she said. Maanvi added that she's yet to accept herself and believe that she's perfect as she is.

240.title: Potential explosive device found at Toronto airport; 2 detained
240.article_body: Two people have been detained after a potential explosive device was found near the ferry terminal of Billy Bishop Airport in Canada's Toronto on Saturday. Passengers were evacuated from the airport and flight operations were suspended while the police conducted an investigation. Later, the airport tweeted that the police have concluded the investigation and the device has been disarmed.

241.title: Team India should cut down Babar's singles, bowl straight: Brett Lee
241.article_body: Ex-Australia pacer Brett Lee said Team India should bowl "nice and straight" to Babar Azam in their T20 World Cup 2022 match against Pakistan. "Cut down the singles...That's the best way to trouble him," added Lee. Talking about Rohit Sharma, Lee stated, "[He]...must...stay in as long as he possibly can...The longer he stays in, the more worried Pakistan will become."

242.title: Thousands gather in Germany in solidarity with protesters in Iran
242.article_body: Tens of thousands of people gathered in Germany's capital city Berlin on Saturday in solidarity with protesters in Iran. People were seen carrying signs which criticised Iranian leaders and had taglines like 'Women, Life, Freedom'. Protests have erupted in Iran after 22-year-old Mahsa Amini died in the custody of morality police after allegedly being detained over "improper hijab".

243.title: Guardian Minister to review development projects in Pune Zilla Parishad
243.article_body: Pune Guardian Minister Chandrakant Patil will be reviewing developmental projects in Pune Zilla Parishad sanctioned by the previous Maha Vikas Aghadi (MVA) government. "Many developmental [projects] in Pune ZP were approved in a hurry in the past. As per the new government resolution, we have decided to scrutinise every work approved by the previous government," said Patil.

244.title: Asked to get jewellery from parents' home, Telangana woman kills husband
244.article_body: A woman killed her husband using a brick in Telangana after he asked her to bring jewellery from her parents' home. Reports said that she hit the man with a brick in a fit of rage. The man sustained injury on his head and died on the spot. The woman surrendered before the police after killing her husband.

245.title: Govt cancels FCRA licence of Rajiv Gandhi Foundation: Reports
245.article_body: The Centre has cancelled the FCRA licence of the Rajiv Gandhi Foundation (RGF), a non-government organisation associated with the Gandhi family, for allegedly violating the foreign funding law, as per officials. The decision was reportedly taken on the basis of investigations carried out by an inter-ministerial committee formed by the Ministry of Home Affairs in July 2020.

246.title: Who won Player of the Match awards in previous India-Pakistan T20 WC matches?
246.article_body: Shaheen Afridi was named Player of the Match in India-Pakistan T20 World Cup 2021 match. Mohammad Asif won the award for taking four wickets in the first-ever India-Pakistan T20 World Cup encounter in 2007. Irfan Pathan won it in final of 2007 edition, while Amit Mishra bagged it in 2014. Virat Kohli won the award in 2012 and 2016 editions.

247.title: Sourav Ganguly names his semi-finalists of T20 World Cup 2022
247.article_body: Former Team India captain Sourav Ganguly has named four teams which according to him will be the semi-finalists of T20 World Cup 2022. Ganguly stated that India, South Africa, Australia and England will reach the last four stage of the tournament. "India will be one of the favourites to win the tournament," he added.

248.title: Conman Sukesh releases letter, says 'Jacqueline never asked me for anything except love'
248.article_body: Sukesh Chandrashekhar, the main accused in ₹200-crore extortion case, has released a letter through his lawyer mentioning that it's "very unfortunate" that Jacqueline Fernandez has been named an accused in the case. "We were in a relationship and if I have given her and her family gifts, what's their fault...She never asked me for anything except loving her," he wrote.

249.title: BJP MP launches Bengaluru South School Leaders' Council for students
249.article_body: BJP MP Tejasvi Surya launched the Bengaluru South School Leaders' Council, comprising school leaders who will be responsible for independently conducting quarterly events. "[It] is a platform to bring school students into public governance & welfare. The Council will work on fields like environment, climate change, civic responsibility, public policy, sports, art and culture," said Surya.

250.title: Who is India's highest run-scorer and highest wicket-taker in T20 World Cup history?
250.article_body: Rohit Sharma is India's highest run-scorer in T20 World Cup history, with 847 runs in 33 matches. He's followed by Virat Kohli, who has scored 845 runs in 21 T20 World Cup matches. Ravichandran Ashwin is India's highest wicket-taker in T20 World Cups, with 26 scalps. He is followed by Ravindra Jadeja (21), Harbhajan Singh (16) and Irfan Pathan (16).

251.title: My style is more aggressive: Ola CEO after report claims he called staff 'useless'
251.article_body: After a report, while citing employees, called Ola's work culture "hostile" and stated that CEO Bhavish Aggarwal used Punjabi epithets at staff and told them they were "useless", Aggarwal said, "My style is more aggressive than probably the average new-age entrepreneur." He added, "A sports environment is not where you have a nine-to-five (work). Ola is a place for...ambitious...people."

252.title: Drunk man bumps into vehicles in Chandigarh, hits ASI when he goes to help
252.article_body: A man who was reportedly in an inebriated state heckled people and bumped into vehicles in Chandigarh. Fearing that the man would hurt himself, a passerby called the Police Control Room.  When the Assistant Sub Inspector went to help after the PCR call, the drunk man beat him up. A police officer said that the man tore ASI's uniform.

253.title: Print of King Charles' artwork sells for ₹5.3 lakh, nearly 10 times estimate
253.article_body: A print of a painting by UK's King Charles III was sold for £5,737.50 (more than ₹5.3 lakh) at a recent auction, nearly 10 times its original estimate. The signed print is one of 100 and was estimated to sell for about £600. The King painted the original artwork depicting the Balmoral Castle, a royal residence in Scotland, in 2001.

254.title: I think Shami might miss out: Kumble on T20 WC 2022 match vs Pak
254.article_body: Ex-India head coach Anil Kumble said he thinks India will pick Harshal Patel, Bhuvneshwar Kumar and Arshdeep Singh as the main pacers in their lineup for their T20 World Cup 2022 match against Pakistan. "I think Mohammad Shami might miss out," added Kumble. Shami picked three wickets while conceding four runs in an over in a warm-up match against Australia.

255.title: It's disgusting: Shweta on trolls against brother Abhishek Bachchan
255.article_body: Shweta Bachchan said that she finds trolling against Abhishek Bachchan "disgusting" and "really upsetting". Shweta said that she finds it unfair that her brother is "constantly compared to something incomparable" like their father Amitabh Bachchan. "You just completely disregard someone's achievements because someone else in his family has done it better...I think it's disgusting," she added.

256.title: Dad or I aren't that rich to pay people to take me in their films: Janhvi
256.article_body: Actress Janhvi Kapoor said that her father or she are not that rich to offer money to people to cast her in their films. She said that the work she's getting now is based on her merit. "They must've appreciated something about me. Nobody is so large-hearted that they'd launch a star kid and take a monetary loss," she added.

257.title: No 'eventbaazi', provide employment: Surjewala on PM's Rozgar Mela
257.article_body: As PM Narendra Modi launched a Rozgar Mela by handing over appointment letters to over 75,000 people, Congress leader Randeep Singh Surjewala said, "No eventbaazi, provide employment." Furthermore, he added, "At least, the 'jumla king' has been forced by Rahul Gandhi to admit that unemployment is the biggest problem the country and the youth face."

258.title: Man tries to cheat in constable exam by hiding accomplice in washroom, held
258.article_body: An aspiring constable, Lalit Yadav, was arrested for allegedly trying to cheat in a recruitment exam by hiding an accomplice, Jaiveer, in the washroom. Jaiveer reportedly also wrote the exam on behalf of Yadav. Police also arrested an official at the exam centre in connection with the case. Police said they have procured CCTV footage from the exam centre.

259.title: Man threatens paan shop owner with air gun in Hyderabad; arrested
259.article_body: A man was arrested for allegedly creating a commotion in Hyderabad's Old City after he threatened a paan shop owner with an air gun on Saturday. An argument occurred after the accused bought three cigarettes from the shop and paid ₹10 but when the shop owner demanded that he should pay the remaining amount, he refused, a police official said.

260.title: Boy fails to alight from train in Navi Mumbai, reunited with family
260.article_body: A 10-year-old Nigerian boy was reunited with his family after he failed to alight from a train at Navi Mumbai's Vashi station and then lost his way, a railway police official said on Saturday. The boy is mentally unwell, the official added. "The boy, his mother, sibling and caretaker were travelling on a Harbour Line local," the official further said.

261.title: Pune man helping lady get illegal power connection for stall electrocuted
261.article_body: A 39-year-old man, Pravin Ashok, was electrocuted in Pune's Aundh after coming in contact with a live wire. He was reportedly helping an unknown lady with an illegal electricity connection for her firecracker stall. Ashok was a daily wage worker and was returning home when the incident took place. Locals immediately rushed him to hospital where he was declared dead.

262.title: Red Bull Co-founder Dietrich Mateschitz passes away aged 78
262.article_body: Red Bull Co-founder Dietrich Mateschitz has passed away at the age of 78. Mateschitz and Thai businessman Chaleo Yoovidhya founded Red Bull in 1984 and launched the Red Bull brand in 1987. Mateschitz owned 49% of the energy drinks brand. The Austrian billionaire bought the Jaguar Formula One team at 2004-end and rebranded it as Red Bull team.

263.title: Google Pixel uses iPhone to mock Apple CEO Tim Cook on Twitter, gets trolled
263.article_body: Google was trolled after the official Twitter handle for its flagship Pixel phone used an iPhone to mock Apple CEO Tim Cook. Google Pixel sent a tweet using an iPhone to troll Cook for using a hashtag that has previously been used by an NBA franchise. Google deleted the tweet after Twitter users called it out and reposted from web.

264.title: Means a hell lot to me: Dinesh Karthik on Ricky Ponting praising him
264.article_body: Reacting to a video of Ricky Ponting praising him and calling him "one of the best finishers", Dinesh Karthik wrote, "Thanks Ricky for these beautiful words...which mean a hell of a lot to me." He added, "I'm hoping to spend some time in...near future with you." Karthik also expressed his gratitude for Rohit Sharma and Abhishek Nayar in the post.

265.title: Barmy Army tweets 'What's an India vs Pakistan? Never heard of it'; gets trolled
265.article_body: Ahead of India-Pakistan T20 World Cup 2022 match in Melbourne, Barmy Army tweeted, "What's an India vs Pakistan...Never heard of it." Trolling Barmy Army, a fan wrote, "Is there any stable govt in England? Never heard of it." Another wrote, "Don't worry, it's a cricket thing, you guys wouldn't know." Another tweet read, "How can you forget your own creation?"

266.title: Ex-Chinese Prez wasn't feeling well: State media after he's escorted out of party meet
266.article_body: After former Chinese President Hu Jintao, who was seated next to Xi Jinping, was unexpectedly escorted out of the closing ceremony of a congress of the ruling Communist Party, state media said he "wasn't feeling well". China's official news agency Xinhua said Jintao insisted on attending the session "despite the fact that he has been taking time to recuperate recently."

267.title: He was kind enough to leave 4-yr-old girl alive: HC on reducing life sentence of her rapist
267.article_body: Madhya Pradesh High Court has reduced the sentence of life imprisonment, awarded to a man convicted of raping a four-year-old girl, to 20-year rigorous imprisonment. "Considering the fact that he was kind enough to leave the prosecutrix alive, this court is of the opinion that the life imprisonment can be reduced," the court said while calling the crime "demonic".

268.title: Have become greedier about the roles I want to do: Sonakshi Sinha
268.article_body: Actress Sonakshi Sinha said she has "become greedier" in terms of the roles she wants to do. "They have to be challenging me in some particular way or something very different from what I've done before," she said, adding that she still goes by her instinct. Sonakshi's upcoming release is 'Double XL', which also stars Huma Qureshi.

269.title: ISRO's heaviest rocket with 36 broadband satellites launched from Sriharikota
269.article_body: ISRO's heaviest rocket LVM3 with 36 broadband satellites onboard was launched from Sriharikota. The satellites belonged to OneWeb, a private communications firm, in which India's Bharti Enterprises is a major investor and shareholder. It is the first commercial mission of LVM3. Further, it is the first time an Indian rocket has been launched with six-ton payload, as per ISRO.

270.title: Hosting FIFA U-17 women's WC was a learning process: Odisha govt
270.article_body: Odisha Sports Secretary Vineel Krishna said that hosting the FIFA Under-17 Women's World Cup was a great learning process. "There are so many things involved in hosting a FIFA event...One has to take care of protocols ranging from security to accreditations," Krishna said. He added, "For the U-17 WC, we had the main stadium and another five training sites."

271.title: TN logs 214 new COVID-19 cases, no deaths in 24 hours
271.article_body: Tamil Nadu recorded 214 fresh cases of COVID-19 in the last 24 hours, the state health department informed on Saturday. No new deaths due to the infection were reported in the state. Tamil Nadu's active case count stood at 3,316, according to the daily COVID-19 bulletin. Chennai logged 53 new cases, the highest among all districts in the state.

272.title: Pak PM Shehbaz calls predecessor Imran Khan a 'certified thief’
272.article_body: Pakistan's Prime Minister Shehbaz Sharif on Saturday called his predecessor Imran Khan a "certified thief" a day after the latter's disqualification over concealment of assets in the Toshakhana case. Pakistan's Election Commission on Friday disqualified Khan from holding public office for five years for failing to declare the money he received from selling state gifts during his tenure as PM.

273.title: Former Pakistani PM Imran Khan challenges disqualification from holding public office
273.article_body: Ex-Pakistani Prime Minister Imran Khan has challenged the Election Commission's ruling which disqualified him from holding public office for a period of five years, his lawyer said on Saturday. On Friday, the Election Commission barred Khan, saying he had illegally sold gifts of the state. With this ruling, Khan also lost his Parliamentary seat.

274.title: Swapna Suresh accuses 3 CPI(M) leaders of seeking sexual favours from her
274.article_body: Swapna Suresh, the prime accused in the 2020 Kerala gold smuggling case, on Friday accused three prominent leaders of the ruling CPI(M) of seeking sexual favours from her. The leaders include former Assembly Speaker P Sreeramakrishnan and former ministers Thomas Isaac and Kadakampally Surendran. Swapna said, "Surendran is a very dirty, pathetic, frustrated and manipulative gentleman."

275.title: Pirelli's 2023 tires can be a huge factor for Ferrari: Carlos Sainz
275.article_body: Ferrari's Carlos Sainz said Pirelli's new tires for the 2023 F1 season might be "a huge factor" for the team. "We need to see what the tyre does to the balance of the car...it will be super interesting to see what Pirelli has come up with," said Sainz. Ferrari has reportedly suffered from high tire degradation in the 2022 season.

276.title: Category 4 hurricane heads towards Mexico's Pacific coast
276.article_body: Hurricane Roslyn on Saturday strengthened to Category 4 force, as it headed for Mexico's Pacific coast. The storm was centered around 170 miles (275 km) south-southwest of Mexican municipality Cabo Corrientes. Roslyn's maximum sustained windspeed rose to 130 mph (215 km/h) on Saturday and was expected to gain further speed, said the US National Hurricane Center.

277.title: Ballon d'Or winner Benzema suffering from muscle fatigue: Real Madrid
277.article_body: Ballon d'Or winner Karim Benzema will miss Real Madrid's match against Sevilla due to a thigh injury. "After the tests today on Karim Benzema...they detected muscular fatigue in the quadriceps of his left leg," said Real Madrid. Benzema, who missed most of September with a thigh strain in his right leg, has five goals in seven league appearances this season.

278.title: Demand for separate 'Frontier Nagaland' state not wrong: CM Rio
278.article_body: Nagaland CM Neiphiu Rio said there is nothing wrong with the demand for a separate state called 'Frontier Nagaland' and that the issue would be resolved soon. "Nagas are very outspoken. They speak their minds out. What they think, and desire," said Rio. Recently, 20 MLAs declared that they will boycott the 2023 Assembly election until the demand is met.

279.title: Take money from BJP, vote for TRS: KTR ahead of Munugode by-polls
279.article_body: Ahead of by-polls in Munugode constituency, TRS working president KTR on Friday urged people to take money from the BJP, but vote for TRS. KTR's comment came after Telangana BJP chief Bandi Sanjay Kumar asked voters to take money from TRS, but elect BJP's Raj Gopal Reddy. KTR alleged that Reddy was openly distributing money to lure voters.

280.title: NIA joins investigation into reported al-Qaeda module in Assam
280.article_body: The Union Home Ministry has directed the National Investigation Agency (NIA) to join the investigation into a reported al-Qaeda module operating in Assam. The module is reportedly connected with Bangladesh-based terror group Ansarullah Bangla Team. According to reports, the module aims to "propagate terror in Indian territory, radicalise likeminded youth and carry out recruitment to wage war".

281.title: Vatican and China extend agreement on appointment of bishops
281.article_body: The Vatican and China extended their agreement on appointment of bishops in the East Asian country on Saturday. In a statement, the Holy See said the 2018 arrangement had been renewed by two years. Entire details of the agreement have never been made public. Earlier, conservative Catholics criticised the deal in view of Beijing's opposition to religious practices.

282.title: What is the average age of India and Pakistan T20 World Cup 2022 teams?
282.article_body: The average age of India squad for T20 World Cup 2022 is 30.5 years. Ten of India players are aged 30 or above. Dinesh Karthik is the oldest member of India squad aged 37, while Arshdeep is the youngest at 23. Meanwhile, the average age of Pakistan squad is 26.2. Shan Masood is oldest member of Pakistan squad at 32.

283.title: Surya doesn't bother me because you can't bat like Viv Richards daily: Aamer
283.article_body: Ahead of the India-Pakistan match in Melbourne on Sunday, former Pakistan skipper Aamer Sohail said that Indian batter Suryakumar doesn't bother him because one can't bat like Viv Richards every day. "Considering Pakistan's bowling line-up, I will go with the Pakistani team [as favourites]...[However,] India also have a lot of talented players," Sohail said.

284.title: Haaland scores twice as Manchester City beat Brighton 3-1 at Etihad
284.article_body: Erling Haaland scored twice and Kevin De Bruyne scored a second-half goal as Manchester City beat Brighton & Hove Albion 3-1 at the Etihad Stadium. The victory moved City on to 26 points from 11 games, one behind league leaders Arsenal. Brighton pulled a goal back when Leandro Trossard scored from the edge of the box against City goalkeeper Ederson.

285.title: UP woman sent 'triple talaq' over WhatsApp by Saudi-based husband
285.article_body: A 27-year-old woman in UP's Aligarh has filed a police complaint claiming that her husband gave her "triple talaq" over WhatsApp from Saudi Arabia. The woman further claimed that she had regular fights with her husband over his dowry demands. The man allegedly sent his wife the triple talaq letter via WhatsApp in the form of a PDF file.

286.title: Karnataka permits use of loudspeakers in 10,889 mosques, 3,000 temples
286.article_body: The Karnataka government has granted permission to 10,889 mosques, 3,000 temples and 1,400 churches in the state to use loudspeakers. The licence has been given for a period of two years. The loudspeakers can only be played between 6 am and 10 pm. A total of 17,850 applications were submitted by mosques, temples and churches for the use of loudspeakers.

287.title: What multiple records were broken in T20 World Cup 2022 today?
287.article_body: New Zealand's Tim Southee became the sole leading wicket-taker in T20I cricket with 125 scalps, overtaking Bangladesh captain Shakib Al Hasan's 122-wicket mark. New Zealand recorded their highest-ever total in T20 WC history (200/3). Sam Curran became the first-ever Englishman to take a five-wicket haul in T20Is. New Zealand also recorded their biggest win (by runs) in T20 WC history.

288.title: Harsha Bhogle names his combined India-Pakistan XI ahead of T20 World Cup match
288.article_body: Commentator Harsha Bhogle on Saturday named his combined India-Pakistan XI ahead of their T20 World Cup 2022 match. Bhogle named captains Rohit Sharma and Babar Azam as openers. He named Virat Kohli and Suryakumar Yadav as number three and four batters, respectively. Other players include Muhammad Rizwan, Hardik Pandya, Shadab Khan, Axar Patel, Mohammad Shami, Shaheen Afridi and Haris Rauf.

289.title: Dengue situation in state completely under control: UP Dy CM Pathak
289.article_body: UP Deputy CM Brajesh Pathak claimed that the dengue situation in the state is under control. He added that people should wear full-sleeve clothes, use mosquito nets and keep their surroundings clean. Pathak further directed all chief medical officers to conduct regular inspections of hospitals, ensure that private pathology labs do not overcharge and ensure patients don't face any problems.

290.title: Curran is thriving with extra responsibility of bowling at death: Buttler
290.article_body: England skipper Jos Buttler said Sam Curran has "character" for bowling at the death after the all-rounder took five wickets to help his side register a five-wicket win against Afghanistan in T20 World Cup 2022 Super 12 stage match. "He's thriving with the extra responsibility. He demands the ball in those situations," he added. Curran posted bowling figures of 3.4-0-10-5.

291.title: Assistant jailer, constable arrested for being drunk in Bihar
291.article_body: An assistant jailer of Bihar's Buxar open jail and a police constable were arrested after they were allegedly found drunk on Saturday. "The anti-liquor task force of Bihar arrested accused near the Bihar-UP border in Buxar on charges of flouting the ban on sale and consumption of alcohol," police said. The accused were sent for medical examination at the hospital.

292.title: Twitter user calls Abhishek Bachchan 'unemployed', actor responds
292.article_body: Abhishek Bachchan responded to a person who said that he was "unemployed". After Abhishek wrote, "Do people still read newspapers??" while replying to a Twitter user, a troll replied, "Intelligent people do. Not unemployed people like you." "Intelligence and employment aren't related...I'm sure you're employed, I'm also sure (judging by your tweet) that you're not intelligent!" Abhishek replied.

293.title: We didn't put good total on board: Afghanistan skipper on loss to England
293.article_body: Following Afghanistan's five-wicket loss against England in T20 World Cup 2022 Super 12 stage match, Afghanistan skipper Mohammad Nabi said his side didn't put a good total on the board. Put to bat first, Afghanistan were bowled out for 112 in 19.4 overs. "It is not a good start, but we tried our best to play good cricket," he added.

294.title: Nottingham Forest beat Liverpool 1-0 to move off last place in PL
294.article_body: Nottingham Forest, who were at the bottom of the Premier League table, beat Liverpool 1-0 at the City Ground stadium to seal their second win of the season. Forest went ahead in the 55th minute when Taiwo Awoniyi hit a rebound after his initial effort struck the post. Forest are now in 19th place with nine points from 12 games.

295.title: 70-yr-old farmer killed by tiger in Maha's Chandrapur; 2nd death in 3 days
295.article_body: A 70-year-old farmer was killed by a tiger on Saturday in Brahmapuri tehsil of Maharashtra's Chandrapur, a forest department official said. Sadashiv Undirwade was at his farm near a forested patch when a tiger pounced on him, killing him instantly, Chandrapur Territorial Circle official said. On October 20, a 40-year-old woman was killed by a tiger in Brahmapuri tehsil.

296.title: Crisis-hit Sri Lanka trims Presidential powers
296.article_body: Sri Lankan lawmakers have voted in favour of amending the Constitution to reduce Presidential powers. The vote, which was held on Friday, came following demands from protesters to reform the country to ease economic difficulties. Now, the President cannot recruit key institutional figures such as senior judges, the attorney general, central bank governors, among other such positions.

297.title: Drunk jail official, constable arrested in Bihar
297.article_body: An assistant jailer of Buxar open jail in Bihar and a constable were arrested on Saturday after they were found in a drunken state, police said. It is suspected the duo consumed liquor in neighbouring UP and then entered Bihar. There has been a ban on the manufacture, trade, storage, transportation, sale, and consumption of liquor in Bihar since 2016.

298.title: Death toll in Banmore house blast rises to five
298.article_body: Another person succumbed to injuries in the Banmore house blast in Madhya Pradesh on Saturday, taking the death toll to five. Four people had died on the spot on Thursday when an explosion went off at a house, which had a stock of crackers in its godown. The house collapsed following the powerful explosion.

299.title: Punjab to form energy action plan to reduce emissions: Officials
299.article_body: Punjab will form an energy action plan to reduce greenhouse gas emissions, said Chief Executive of Punjab Energy Development Agency (PEDA) Sumeet Jarangal. He said innovative clean energy technologies will have to be adopted to reduce emissions. He added that PEDA is striving to attain the target of 2,500 MW renewable energy capacity in Punjab.

300.title: ISRO set to launch 36 OneWeb broadband communication satellites
300.article_body: The Indian Space Research Organisation (ISRO) is all set to launch 36 broadband communication satellites from the Satish Dhawan Space Centre in Andhra Pradesh's Sriharikota on Sunday. A 43.5-metre-tall rocket is going to carry the satellites, which will be placed in the Low Earth Orbit (LEO). The total weight of the 36 OneWeb satellites in LEO is about 5,796 kilograms.

301.title: Odisha man gets 15 years in jail for raping minor girl
301.article_body: A court in Odisha's Mayurbhanj district on Saturday sentenced a man to 15 years of rigorous imprisonment for the rape of a minor girl in 2014. The victim was 15 years old at the time of the offence, according to the prosecution. The convict raped her when she was alone in her house. The teenager got pregnant following the incident.

302.title: 4 MLAs from Uddhav faction are in touch with me: BJP's Rane
302.article_body: BJP leader Narayan Rane said that four Shiv Sena MLAs from the Uddhav Thackeray faction are in touch with him but he won't take the names. "From 56 MLAs, there are hardly six to seven left [in the Uddhav Thackeray faction]. Those too are on the way out," Rane, who is also a Union Minister, said.

303.title: Saw pools of blood, heard cries like 'God save me': Rewa mishap survivor
303.article_body: A 30-year-old labourer who survived the bus accident in Madhya Pradesh's Rewa said he was fast asleep and was celebrating Diwali in his dreams when the accident took place. "I woke up to a loud thud...[and heard] cries like 'God save me, God help me'," Subhash Choudhary added. "I saw...people [lying] in pools of blood inside the bus," he claimed.

304.title: Fire occurs in sweet shop in Odisha's Rourkela; 1 dead
304.article_body: A fire occurred in a sweet shop in Odisha's Rourkela on Saturday. The incident led to the death of the confectioner and sweets worth over ₹2 lakh, which were being prepared for Diwali, were destroyed, police said. The deceased, Arun Yadav, hailed from Bihar's Gaya and was brought to Rourkela due to the soaring demand ahead of Diwali.

305.title: Rubina gets injured while rehearsing for Jhalak Dikhhla Jaa, shares pic of neck injury
305.article_body: 'Jhalak Dikhhla Jaa 10' contestant Rubina Dilaik was injured while rehearsing with her partner-choreographer Sanam Johar. She shared a picture of her injured neck and a video from rehearsal. In the video, Sanam can be seen running towards her to practise their dance stunt but instead ends up hitting her accidentally. "Few things are not in our control," wrote Rubina.

306.title: SA are 'chupe rustam', easily capable of beating the best in T20 WC: Farokh
306.article_body: Talking about South Africa's chances at T20 World Cup 2022, ex-India wicketkeeper-batter Farokh Engineer said they are a 'chupe rustam'. He added, "They're a very dangerous side...easily capable of beating the best. I won't be surprised if South Africa even come in the final." He further said, "My four (semi-finalists)- Australia, England, India and either South Africa or Pakistan."

307.title: What is the latest weather forecast for Melbourne where India will face Pak tomorrow?
307.article_body: India are scheduled to face Pakistan in T20 World Cup 2022 in Melbourne tomorrow. Australia's Bureau of Meteorology stated there could be "an afternoon shower or two" in Melbourne tomorrow. It added there's 70% chance of "any rain" in Melbourne tomorrow, most likely in the "late afternoon and evening". Earlier, the bureau stated that there was 90% chance of rain.

308.title: Russia launches 36 missiles at Ukraine, 15 lakh people left without electricity: Zelenskyy
308.article_body: Ukraine President Volodymyr Zelenskyy has said that Russia launched around 36 missiles at Ukraine overnight. He added that most of those missiles were shot down. He further stated that around 15 lakh people across Ukraine were left without electricity due to Russia's attacks. October 24 will mark eight months since the war commenced.

309.title: We've plans for everyone, not just Suryakumar: Babar ahead of Pak vs India
309.article_body: Ahead of Pakistan's first T20 World Cup 2022 Super 12 stage match against India, Pakistan captain Babar Azam said his side has plans for every player and not just Suryakumar Yadav. "We have plans and hopefully, we can execute them properly," he added. The match will be played at the Melbourne Cricket Ground on Sunday.

310.title: 5 minor girls collecting soil from drain drown in Uttar Pradesh village
310.article_body: Five girls, aged between nine and 13, drowned while collecting soil from a drain in a village in Uttar Pradesh's Sultanpur on Saturday, police said. Chief Minister Yogi Adityanath has expressed deep sorrow over the loss of lives. While the bodies of four girls were pulled out shortly after the incident, divers recovered the fifth girl's body in the evening.

311.title: BJP will form government in Himachal Pradesh again: Anurag Thakur
311.article_body: Union Minister and BJP leader Anurag Thakur on Saturday said his party will form government in Himachal Pradesh again as people have seen the working of "double-engine" government. "We'll get the benefit of the leadership which PM Narendra Modi gave in the country and...CM Jairam Thakur at the state level," he said, adding BJP will also retain power in Gujarat.

312.title: Chemistry lab roof collapses at 105-yr-old Maharani college in Mysuru
312.article_body: The roof of the chemistry lab at 105-year-old Maharani's Science College for Women in Mysuru collapsed on Friday. No injuries were reported. Minutes before the mishap took place, principal Dr D Ravi had instructed the staff to disconnect the power supply and lock the lab. The chemistry department's head had alerted him about water seepage in the roof.

313.title: 3 people test positive for Ebola in Uganda's capital Kampala
313.article_body: Three people in an isolation unit of Uganda's main hospital in the capital city of Kampala tested positive for Ebola on Friday, Uganda's Health Minister said. The three confirmed cases are the first known transmission of the virus in the city. This came on the same day the government said the country's current Ebola outbreak was coming under control.

314.title: Kerala replacing Punjab as 'capital of drugs': Guv Arif Mohammed Khan
314.article_body: Kerala Governor Arif Mohammed Khan on Saturday said the state was replacing Punjab as the "capital of drugs". He said he felt ashamed that the two main sources of revenue of the state were lottery and alcohol. "What a shameful situation for a state which has 100% literacy," he said, adding liquor consumption was being encouraged in the state.

315.title: 4 Maoists, including 1 woman, arrested in J'khand's Palamu district
315.article_body: Four alleged Maoists, including a woman, were arrested in Jharkhand's Palamu district on Saturday, police said. The individuals were reportedly arrested during a police raid in the Chhatarpur area, around 200 km from Ranchi. "We had arrested self-styled sub-zonal commander of CPI (Maoist), Ram Prasad Yadav, two days back. Based on his inputs, four other Maoists were nabbed," police stated.

316.title: There is infighting in BJP families over MLA tickets in Himachal: Lamba
316.article_body: Congress spokesperson Alka Lamba said that there is "infighting in BJP families" of Himachal Pradesh over the MLA tickets distribution. "I recently visited the Mandi region. BJP Minister Mahender Singh Thakur is an example of BJP practising dynastic politics as his son has been given a ticket," Lamba said. She added that unemployment and inflation are key issues in Himachal.

317.title: Maha to take TN Police's help after 10 idols get stolen from Ram temple
317.article_body: Police in Maharashtra will take the help of Tamil Nadu Police to solve the theft of idols from a Ram temple in Jalna, SP Akshay Shinde said on Saturday. At least 10 idols were allegedly stolen from the temple in the village, which is the birthplace of the saint Ramdas Samarth. Police have scanned all phone calls made during investigation.

318.title: 3 killed in accident in UP's Hamirpur; accused absconding
318.article_body: Three people were killed in a road accident near the Maudaha intersection on Kabrai Sagar Road in Hamirpur, UP. The accident occurred when the vehicle in which the three deceased were travelling collided with a dumper, police said. The deceased have been identified as Lakhanlal (35), Pawan (29) and Rahul (19). Notably, the dumper's driver is still absconding.

319.title: Tehran condemns call for probe into alleged use of Iranian drones in Ukraine
319.article_body: Tehran on Saturday strongly condemned a call by France, Germany and Britain for the UN to probe the alleged involvement of Iranian-made drones in attacks against Ukrainian targets by Russian forces, Iran's Foreign Ministry said. The ministry dismissed the accusations as "false and baseless". Iran denies supplying drones to Russia for the war in Ukraine.

320.title: We were clinical: NZ captain Williamson on their 89-run win vs Australia
320.article_body: New Zealand skipper Kane Williamson said his side was clinical in their win against defending champions Australia in T20 World Cup 2022. "Everyone knows their roles in this team, we knew about the quality of their bowling (Australia's), took the game deep," he added. New Zealand defeated Australia by 89 runs in their first Super 12 stage match on Saturday.

321.title: 18-yr-old Gauff is the same age as my career: 33-yr-old Azarenka
321.article_body: After 33-year-old Victoria Azarenka defeated 18-year-old Coco Gauff in Guadalajara Open Akron quarter-final, the ex-world number one said, "I was just thinking, 'Coco is the same age as my career,' so it felt pretty interesting." Azarenka added, "She's such a great athlete...I can't wait to see how far she'll go." The two-time Grand Slam champion turned pro in 2003.

322.title: Mumbai woman loses ₹8 lakh after clicking on bogus ad on Facebook
322.article_body: A Mumbai-based woman lost ₹8.46 lakh after she clicked on a fraudulent Facebook advertisement about a 'buy one get one free' offer for Maharaja Bhog Thalis. The woman claimed that while trying to pay ₹200 she inadvertently allowed remote access to her phone using which the fraudsters withdrew the amount from her account in 27 transactions, the Bandra Police said.

323.title: England beat Afghanistan as Curran records best T20I bowling figures by an Englishman
323.article_body: England defeated Afghanistan by five wickets in their first T20 World Cup 2022 Super 12 stage match on Saturday. England dismissed Afghanistan for 112 runs in 19.4 overs and chased down the target in 18.1 overs. The match witnessed fast bowler Sam Curran become the first-ever England bowler to take a five-wicket haul in men's T20I cricket history.

324.title: 4 of a family killed as boulder falls on houses in Uttarakhand
324.article_body: Four members of a family were killed after a massive boulder fell on three houses after a landslide in Uttarakhand's Chamoli on Saturday, the State Disaster Response Force (SDRF) said. The deceased were identified as 75-year-old Bachuli Devi, 37-year-old Sunita Devi, 57-year-old Devanand and 45-year-old Ghananand. A 15-year-old boy, who sustained injuries, was referred to the higher centre.

325.title: They hit me in the crotch, locked me up in the loo of a jail: Arnab Goswami on his arrest
325.article_body: Republic TV's Editor-in-Chief Arnab Goswami, while speaking about his arrest in November 2020, said, "They were pushing me with the butt of their weapons, hitting me in the crotch, thrashing me and not even letting me wear my shoes." "[They locked] me up in the loo of a jail, [did] things which are unbelievable," he added.

326.title: Goa CM urges citizens to encourage 'vocal for local' initiative this Diwali
326.article_body: Goa CM Pramod Sawant on Saturday urged citizens to encourage the "vocal for local" initiative and consider local products while shopping for Diwali festival. "It may be akashkandil (lantern), eatables or even flowers, always choose to buy items that are made locally," he said. Sawant said that he himself has put up a lantern made of coconut tree leaves.

327.title: Robin Uthappa names his 4 semi-finalists of T20 World Cup 2022, excludes India
327.article_body: Former India wicketkeeper-batter Robin Uthappa has named four teams which according to him will be the semi-finalists at the ongoing T20 World Cup 2022. "My semi-finalists would be Australia, England, Pakistan, and South Africa," said Uthappa. On excluding India, Uthappa said, "I do not think [Indian fans] would be too happy [with my prediction]."

328.title: Pilots sent 'Mayday' call moments before Army helicopter crash in Arunachal
328.article_body: Pilots of an Indian Army helicopter, which crashed in Arunachal Pradesh's Upper Siang, killing five, had issued a 'Mayday' call to the Air Traffic Control (ATC). According to officials, the pilot had reached out to the ATC flagging a technical failure in the aircraft. "It is reported that the weather was good for flying operations," a Defence spokesperson said.

329.title: Kids of photojournalist Danish, who was killed in Afghanistan, receive his Pulitzer Prize
329.article_body: Reuters photojournalist Danish Siddiqui's children accepted the Pulitzer Prize on his behalf. Danish Siddiqui was killed while covering the Afghanistan conflict in July last year. Yunus Siddiqui, 6, Sarah Siddiqui, 4, children of the late Danish Siddiqui received the award in a ceremony in New York. He was also awarded the Pulitzer Prize in 2018.

330.title: Are BSF jawans eating biryani and sleeping at the border?: Owaisi
330.article_body: AIMIM chief Asaduddin Owaisi questioned the Centre and BSF after the RSS blamed infiltration for an alleged population imbalance in India. "If people are coming from Bangladesh, what are your BSF jawans doing at the border? Eating biryani and sleeping?" questioned Owaisi. The RSS claimed that conversion and Bangladeshi migrants were the primary reasons behind the alleged population imbalance.

331.title: Ashok Gehlot hosts Diwali lunch for kids who lost parents to COVID-19
331.article_body: Rajasthan CM Ashok Gehlot on Friday hosted a Diwali programme for more than 200 children who recently lost both their parents to COVID-19. The programme, reportedly organised at his residence, included a luncheon, a magic show and other activities. The 71-year-old leader was seen interacting with children and participating in games with them. He said children were also given gifts.

332.title: Magnitude 5.5 earthquake hits China's western Sichuan region
332.article_body: A 5.5-magnitude earthquake struck the western part of China's Sichuan province on Saturday, the European Mediterranean Seismological Centre (EMSC) said. The earthquake's focus was located at a depth of 80 km, the EMSC informed. Last month, on September 5, an earthquake of magnitude 6.8 struck Luding County in Sichuan province causing the death of 93 people and injuring hundreds.

333.title: 7 persons injured in blast at Bharat Petroleum oil depot near Bhopal
333.article_body: Seven persons sustained injuries in a blast that occurred at the Bharat Petroleum Corporation Limited's (BPCL) depot on the outskirts of Bhopal in Madhya Pradesh, police said on Saturday. "Six of the injured persons are either drivers or helpers of the Hindustan Petroleum Corporation Limited (HPCL), who were there to get fuel filled in their tankers," an officer said.

334.title: MCG pitch should make for a really good IND-PAK game: Curator
334.article_body: Ahead of the India-Pakistan match in Melbourne on Sunday, MCG pitch curator Michael Salvatore said that the wicket should make for a really good game between the two sides. "So we have drop-in wickets here at the MCG. So for the cricket season, we bring the wickets in and I sit on some sand and bed in nicely," Salvatore said.

335.title: It's a challenge for India to come out on top in ICC tournaments: Rohit
335.article_body: India captain Rohit Sharma said it's a challenge for the team to come out on top in ICC tournaments given their record in the last nine years. India haven't won an ICC trophy since MS Dhoni-led India won Champions Trophy in 2013. Rohit added that his side have the opportunity to do well in ongoing T20 World Cup in Australia.

336.title: We were completely outplayed: Aus captain on loss vs NZ in T20 WC 2022
336.article_body: After Australia's 89-run defeat against New Zealand in their first T20 World Cup 2022 Super 12 stage match, Australia captain Aaron Finch said his side was completely outplayed. He added that New Zealand openers set the tone in the first four overs and the defending champions didn't recover. Chasing 201, Australia were bowled out for 111 in 17.1 overs.

337.title: Percentage of NCR houses bursting crackers this Diwali could be highest in 5 yrs: Survey
337.article_body: The percentage of households in Delhi-NCR that will burst firecrackers on Diwali could be the highest in five years, according to a survey. The survey, which was conducted by LocalCircles, said two of every five families are likely to burst crackers. About 10% of the surveyed said they had bought crackers from shops in Delhi.

338.title: Delhi Police officer's daughter arrested for hitting man with car
338.article_body: A senior Delhi Police official's daughter was arrested on Saturday for allegedly hitting a parking valet with her car earlier this week at a mall in Delhi's Saket area, ANI reported. The incident was reportedly caught on surveillance cameras. The woman's car allegedly ran over the valet's legs while he was attending to a customer, leaving him injured.

339.title: KL Rahul is correct enough to rack up runs in T20 WC 2022: Pietersen
339.article_body: Kevin Pietersen has predicted India opener KL Rahul to end T20 World Cup 2022 as the highest run-scorer. "With the ball bouncing, swinging and seaming, I think he plays in a very authentic way and is correct enough to rack up the runs," said Pietersen. "He is the number one batter in the world at the moment," he added.

340.title: Former village head shot over political rivalry in UP
340.article_body: A former village head was shot in Ballan village in Banda, UP on Saturday. The accused, Bhanjan Singh (56), has been arrested in connection with the incident, which seems to have taken place allegedly over a political rivalry, police said. The victim, Omkar Dwivedi (54), was rushed to the Kanpur medical college where his condition remains critical, police added.

341.title: Former Pune Municipal Commissioner blames "slothful" citizens for flooding
341.article_body: Former Pune Municipal Commissioner Mahesh Zagade has blamed "clueless" civic body officials and "slothful" citizens for the recent flooding and traffic chaos in the city. "I will not blame the politicians for the mess Pune city finds itself in. I will instead blame Pune's fast asleep citizens and clueless PMC officials for the nightmare," Zagade said.

342.title: DCP Bhagyashree Navtake to take charge of Pune traffic branch
342.article_body: Commissioner of Police, Pune, Amitabh Gupta has ordered Deputy Commissioner of Police (Economic Offences Wing and Cyber Cell) Bhagyashree Navtake to take charge of the traffic branch. The decision was taken even as DCP (Traffic) Rahul Shrirame continues in his post. According to the order, Shrirame will have to "submit a report to Navtake regarding traffic work".

343.title: Noida Traffic Police issues advisory for festive period
343.article_body: The Noida Traffic Police has issued a traffic advisory for the festive period of Dhanteras, Diwali and Bhai Dooj. According to which, Indira Market, Atta Market, Sector 18 Market, Gurudwara, Gardens Galleria Mall, GIP Mall and surrounding areas are no parking zones. The stretch from Attapir Chowk to Car Market Sector 28 will be banned for rickshaws from 2 pm.

344.title: Journalist asks 'Are all players singing 'Rain Rain Go Away'?', Babar's response goes viral
344.article_body: A video of Pakistan captain Babar Azam's response to a journalist asking "Are all players singing 'Rain Rain Go Away?'" ahead of India-Pakistan T20 World Cup match in Melbourne went viral. "No sir...We aren't singing lullaby to...child," Babar joked. He added weather isn't in players' hands. There are 70% chances of rain in Melbourne on Sunday, as per forecast.

345.title: Man uses B'luru sexologist's identity to harass women with pics on FB
345.article_body: A 35-year-old man was arrested last week for misusing the identity of a renowned sexologist in Bengaluru on social media. The arrest was made after medical practitioner Dr Padmini Prasad lodged a complaint with cyber police. According to police, the accused created fake Facebook accounts in the name of Prasad to approach women and harass them with messages and pictures.

346.title: Bengaluru has received 311 mm of rainfall in October so far: IMD
346.article_body: In October, Bengaluru has so far received 311 mm of rainfall, which is a deviation of 189 mm from the normal, as per the India Meteorological Department (IMD). Further, Bengaluru has already received 1,795.5 mm of rainfall this year. "Owing to increasing concretisation, the rainfall pattern has...been erratic and the city is receiving heavy rainfall," an IMD scientist said.

347.title: Curran creates history, becomes 1st England bowler to take a 5-wicket haul in T20Is
347.article_body: England's 24-year-old all-rounder Sam Curran has created history by becoming the first-ever England bowler to take a five-wicket haul in T20I cricket. Curran registered bowling figures of 3.4-0-10-5 against Afghanistan in England's first T20 World Cup 2022 Super 12 stage match on Saturday to achieve the feat. His figures helped England bowl Afghanistan out for 112 in 19.4 overs.

348.title: Hyderabad Police arrest 3 vehicle thieves; 2 cars, 2 bikes seized
348.article_body: The Hyderabad Police on Friday arrested three vehicle thieves, identified as Syed Ahmed, Syed Omer and Shaik Ameer. Police recovered two Indica cars and two bikes from the accused. Another accused, identified as Jaffar, is currently absconding, the police stated in a press release. Two accused and recovered vehicles were handed over to Cyberabad Police for further action, police stated.

349.title: Two arrested after police raid Thane spa for vulgar activities
349.article_body: The Mira Bhayandar-Vasai Virar Police raided a spa on Mira Road that was alleged to be indulging in vulgar activities under the guise of massage services. Acting on a tip-off, the police deputed a decoy customer to bust the racket and arrested a female employee and an operator. The Ank Luxurious Salon and Spa is located in the Kanakia area.

350.title: Indian campaign ends at Denmark Open as Lakshya loses in quarters
350.article_body: Commonwealth Games 2022 gold medal-winning shuttler Lakshya Sen crashed out of Denmark Open 2022 on Friday. The 21-year-old lost to Japan's Kodai Naraoka 17-21, 12-21 in the men's singles quarter-final. With this, the Indian campaign ended in Odense. Earlier in the day, Indian men's doubles pair of Satwiksairaj Rankireddy and Chirag Shetty lost in the quarter-final.

351.title: NMMC seizes over 1.40 lakh kg of single-use plastic in last 3 months
