351.article_body: The Navi Mumbai Municipal Corporation (NMMC) has seized over 1.40 lakh kg of plastic in the last three months, the highest since the state banned single-use plastic in 2018. Last week, civic officials seized over 800 kg of banned plastic from a wholesale seller. The team also caught the female salesperson selling plastic bags to vendors and hawkers every day.

352.title: Villagers bathe in mud water to protest against bad roads in Karnataka
352.article_body: Locals took bath in the mud water accumulated on a road in Karnataka's Hulikeri village to protest against the poor condition of roads in the area. The protesters also shouted slogans against the authorities. They claimed officials have taken no action despite repeated requests from villagers. A nearly four km stretch of road is currently flooded in the area.

353.title: Manage glucose confidently this festive season: Abbott FreeStyle Libre
353.article_body: Abbott's FreeStyle Libre is a sensor-based continuous glucose monitoring device that helps people with diabetes track their glucose levels. This wearable product monitors glucose levels without fingerpricks & calculates time spent in the desired range. It enables users make informed decisions on lifestyle modifications and dietary control, owing to the ease of sharing real-time data with experts.

354.title: Solid start for their campaign: Irfan on NZ's 89-run win vs Aus in T20 WC
354.article_body: Reacting to New Zealand's 89-run win against Australia in T20 World Cup 2022 Super 12 stage, Irfan Pathan tweeted, "Kiwis dominated the game from the first over. Solid start for their campaign." Wasim Jaffer said, "New Zealand beat Australia and declare the T20 World Cup open!!" Ian Bishop tweeted, "Fantastic opening performance by 2021 runners-up against the defending champs."

355.title: Argentina fear no one at 2022 FIFA World Cup: Messi
355.article_body: Argentinian skipper Lionel Messi said that his side fears no one at the upcoming 2022 FIFA World Cup. "Today we are doing well and people are excited and think that we will come back with the WC, but it is not like that," Messi said. He added, "WC is very difficult, many things have to happen [to win it]."

356.title: Crypto exchange Gate.io's Twitter compromised to promote fake giveaway: Report
356.article_body: Hackers of unknown origin gained control of the official Twitter account of cryptocurrency exchange Gate.io and altered the website URL to a fraudulent website mimicking the exchange, Cointelegraph reported. The fake website reportedly promoted a fake giveaway of 500,000 USDT and asked users to connect their wallets. Rewards are used as a pretext to gain access to users' personal funds.

357.title: UK lawmaker Matheson resigns over ‘unwanted sexual advances’
357.article_body: UK lawmaker Christian Matheson has resigned after a parliamentary watchdog recommended his suspension over "serious sexual misconduct". The watchdog said Matheson had breached parliament's sexual misconduct policy by making "unwanted and unwelcome" advances towards a junior staff member. Matheson allegedly invited the colleague on a private trip abroad, which was found to be "sexually motivated".

358.title: AIIMS Delhi chief issues order to stop vendors from sending him gifts
358.article_body: AIIMS Delhi Director, Dr M Srinivas, has directed the medical college and hospital's security and administration officials to not let representatives of vendors, contractors and agencies into his office with gifts on festive occasions. "I do not accept gifts or greetings from such people," the newly-appointed AIIMS Delhi chief said in an order, as per media reports.

359.title: Pic shows remains of a supernova, Instagram user says 'Beyond beautiful'
359.article_body: NASA shared a composite image showing the remains of a supernova, around 9,000 light-years from Earth, in three bands of X-ray light detected by Chandra X-ray Observatory telescope. It shows low energy X-rays in red, medium in green, and the highest in blue. "Beyond beautiful...space is magical and mysterious," an Instagram user commented, while another comment read, "This is awesome."

360.title: MP CM Shivraj Chouhan to celebrate Diwali with COVID orphans at his residence
360.article_body: Madhya Pradesh CM Shivraj Singh Chouhan said that he would celebrate Diwali at his residence with children who lost their parents due to COVID-19. "I will celebrate the festival of Diwali with my sons, daughters, nephews, and nieces who have lost their parents...I feel happy to celebrate the festival with them and to share happiness with them," said Chouhan.

361.title: 150 bottles of premium foreign liquor seized in excise raids in Delhi
361.article_body: The Delhi government's excise department has arrested five people and registered three separate FIRs in connection with the adulteration of high-end foreign liquor. Almost 150 bottles of premium foreign liquor and 20 empty bottles were recovered during the raids. The gang included some bartenders who mixed premium foreign liquor with cheap Indian Made Foreign Liquor (IMFL) for sale purposes.

362.title: RSS raising religious conversion issue to divert attention: BSP chief
362.article_body: BSP chief Mayawati on Saturday alleged that RSS is raising issues related to religious conversion and population policy to divert people's attention from failures of BJP-led government at Centre. She said it is an irony that the RSS supports the BJP in every election with its "eyes closed". "Its silence on the prevailing atmosphere in the country is...harmful," Mayawati said.

363.title: 3 members of disbanded Hong Kong pro-democracy group jailed
363.article_body: Three members of the now-disbanded Hong Kong pro-democracy student group, Student Politicism, have been sentenced to up to three years in prison for conspiracy to incite subversion. The activists, aged 19 to 21, were accused of making speeches and handing out leaflets urging public to overthrow the Chinese government. Wong Yat-chin, Chan Chi-sum and Jessica Chu pleaded guilty in July.

364.title: 4 friends celebrating a birthday drown in pond at temple in Thane
364.article_body: Four of five friends from Mumbai who had gone to Thane to celebrate a birthday drowned in a pond next to the Kondeshwar Shiv temple on Friday. According to police, the friends jumped into the pond unaware that it was deep after a certain point. One of them, 19-year-old Pratik Hate, managed to swim to safety, but the remaining drowned.

365.title: 59-year-old Mumbai man loses leg while trying to board BEST bus
365.article_body: A 59-year-old resident of Mumbai, Surendra Shinde, lost his left leg while he was trying to board a BEST bus in Sewri area on October 18. He was admitted to KEM Hospital where his leg was amputated below the knee. "His right leg was on the steps, but due to the jerking movement...the loose sheet crushed his...leg," Shinde's relative said.

366.title: Bank of Baroda-backed IndiaFirst Life Insurance files DRHP with SEBI for IPO
366.article_body: IndiaFirst Life Insurance, backed by Bank of Baroda (BoB) filed its draft red herring prospectus (DRHP) with SEBI for an IPO this year. The IPO will comprise a fresh issue of ₹500 crore and an offer for sale of 14.12 crore shares. BoB has a 65% stake in the life insurer and Union Bank of India has a 9% stake.

367.title: H'wood filmmaker approaches Vipul Amrutlal Shah for remake rights of 'Sanak'
367.article_body: Hollywood filmmaker Kylan Tyng has approached filmmaker Vipul Amrutlal Shah for the remake rights of 'Sanak', a 2021 action-thriller film which featured Vidyut Jammwal and Neha Dhupia, among others. Talking about it, Vipul said, "I'm the only person whose two films have been inquired [about] by Hollywood for remakes...I am super excited and I really hope that this will materialise."

368.title: PM Modi, Amit Shah, Nadda among BJP campaigners for Himachal polls
368.article_body: The BJP on Friday released a list of 40 campaigners for the upcoming Himachal Pradesh Assembly elections. The list features Prime Minister Narendra Modi, party chief JP Nadda, Defence Minister Rajnath Singh and Home Minister Amit Shah. Himachal Pradesh CM Jairam Thakur, Uttar Pradesh CM Yogi Adityanath and Haryana CM Manohar Lal Khattar are also included in the list.

369.title: India's growth, stability concerns are less than that of world: Finance Ministry
369.article_body: Estimating India's medium-term growth rate above 6%, the Finance Ministry said, the country's growth and stability concerns are less than that of the world at large. "A long-awaited domestic investment cycle that had started will accelerate once current external shocks – geopolitical conflicts and monetary tightening – fade...Corporate and bank balance sheets in India are ready for it.," it said.

370.title: Akshay shares fan's Phir Hera Pheri-inspired rangoli, says 'I love it'
370.article_body: Akshay Kumar responded to a fan who had tweeted a picture of a rangoli inspired by a scene from his film 'Phir Hera Pheri'. "Dear @akshaykumar, award winning rangoli in my office. I hope you like this," the fan wrote. Akshay responded, "Like this? I love it! Hope it brings a smile on all...visitors' faces like it did on mine."

371.title: Half of Ukraine's thermal production stations hit by Russian strikes: Min
371.article_body:
Ukrainian Energy Minister German Galushchenko said Russian air strikes have hit at least half of Ukraine's thermal generation capacity since October 10, resulting in billions of dollars in damage. 
However, not all of these thermal power plants have entirely stopped production, Galushchenko told Reuters. He further said that Ukraine may need electricity imports to get through the winter.

372.title: ICICI Bank's Q2 profit up by 37% to ₹7,558 cr as bad loan provisions fall
372.article_body: ICICI Bank posted a 37% year-on-year growth in standalone profit at ₹7,557.84 crore for the September quarter as against ₹5,511 crore in the corresponding period last year led by a fall in bad loan provisions. Its net interest income surged to ₹14,787 crore year-on-year compared to ₹11,690 crore last year. It registered a 25% year-on-year growth in retail loan portfolio.

373.title: Industrialist, wife & teenage daughter set themselves ablaze in B'luru
373.article_body: An industrialist, his wife and their teenage daughter died after allegedly setting themselves ablaze in Bengaluru's HSR Layout on Friday. The family from Kerala had shifted to Bengaluru a few years ago. Police said the industrialist, Santosh, ran a small tool manufacturing factory. Losses in business and failure to repay loans are the prime reasons behind the suicide, they added.

374.title: BJP will win more seats in Gujarat than last time: Anurag Thakur
374.article_body: Union Minister Anurag Thakur exuded confidence that the BJP will win the upcoming Gujarat Assembly polls and said that the party will win more seats than last time. He claimed that AAP would not be able to win a single seat in the polls. "AAP has nothing. The states in which they've formed governments are in bad shape," said Thakur.

375.title: Ask your MP to quit being Dy Chairman of RS: Kishor to Bihar CM
375.article_body: Political strategist Prashant Kishor accused Bihar CM Nitish Kumar of continuing to be in touch with the BJP. "If you have nothing to do with BJP/ NDA then ask your MP to quit the post of Deputy Chairman of Rajya Sabha," tweeted Kishor, talking about JD(U)'s Harivansh. CM Kumar had denied the allegations and said Kishor was speaking for publicity.

376.title: Pregnant woman, mother killed as ambulance hits tree in Tamil Nadu
376.article_body: A 20-year-old pregnant woman and her mother were killed after an ambulance they were in crashed into a tree in Tamil Nadu's Sivaganga district on Friday. The woman was reportedly in labour when she was travelling with her family members in the vehicle. Three other people are being treated at a hospital.

377.title: AAP Corporator Sejal Malaviya bites female security guard at Surat meeting
377.article_body: An AAP Corporator, Sejal Malaviya, reportedly bit a female security guard when she was being moved out of a meeting of the Surat Municipal Corporation's General Board in Surat. Reports said that the incident took place on Friday when BJP leader Amit Rajput tried to raise the oath issue involving Delhi's former Social Justice Minister Rajendra Pal Gautam.

378.title: Cognizant promoted 42,000 employees in FY22, spent $130 mn in hikes: Report
378.article_body: IT company Cognizant promoted around 42,000 employees in FY22 and spent $130 million (over ₹1,000 crore) in the year for merit-based and off-cycle increments, ToI reported citing an MCA filing. It also promoted 13,810 employees up to associate director levels, spending $36 million, an average increase of 14%. It also rolled out target merit assessment effective from July last year.

379.title: Texas state police fire 1st officer over Uvalde shooting which killed 19 kids
379.article_body: Texas Department of Public Safety has fired a policeman who was at the scene of the Uvalde school massacre in which 19 children and two teachers were killed. Juan Maldonado is the first state police force member to be fired in the case. A gunman armed with AR-15-style rifle went on a shooting rampage at Robb Elementary School in May.

380.title: Nigerian DJ on student visa in Pune arrested for overstay in India
380.article_body: Pune City Police has arrested the 31-year-old Nigerian DJ 'Echo Buzz' for allegedly overstaying in India. The accused had come to India on a student visa a few years ago to study at Fergusson College, police said. The DJ stayed at a housing complex in Kondhwa's Yewalewadi area and has been overstaying in the country since 2014, police added.

381.title: 978 colonies within Hyderabad ORR to receive water by March 2023
381.article_body: The work related to providing water supply to 978 colonies, located outside Greater Hyderabad Municipal Corporation (GHMC) limits and within Outer Ring Road (ORR), is set to be finished by March 2023. "While...construction of reservoirs is underway, the water distribution network will be built simultaneously so...there are no delays," Hyderabad Metropolitan Water Supply and Sewerage Board MD said.

382.title: 70,000 jobs 'oont ke muh me jeera': Surjewala on PM's Rozgar Mela
382.article_body: As PM Modi launched Rozgar Mela in which appointment letters are to be handed over to 75,000 people, the Congress called it "oont ke muh me jeera". Congress leader Randeep Singh Surjewala said, "Modiji, you promised two crore jobs every year, which makes it 16 crore jobs in eight years...The youth want employment. Rahul Gandhi will keep raising their questions."

383.title: NZ record their biggest-ever T20 WC victory, win a match in Australia after 10 years
383.article_body: New Zealand defeated Australia by 89 runs in their first T20 World Cup 2022 Super 12 stage match on Saturday. It is New Zealand's biggest-ever victory (by runs) in T20 World Cup history. Further, New Zealand have registered a victory in international cricket on Australian soil after more than 10 years.

384.title: A photographer jumped on car's bonnet for Aishwarya's pic, could've died: Jaya
384.article_body: Jaya Bachchan recalled how a photographer "could have died" while trying to take Aishwarya Rai's picture after her wedding in 2007. She said, "The day we were bringing Aishwarya...for 'griha pravesh', [Amitabh] was driving the car...We'd created...podium for...media, so that they could take pictures...One guy jumped on...bonnet of car...[Amitabh] lost his cool...our security took these people on."

385.title: API, constable booked for demanding bribe of ₹50,000 in Pune
385.article_body: The Anti-Corruption Bureau (ACB) officials booked an assistant police inspector (API) and a police constable in Pune for demanding a bribe of ₹50,000. The constable demanded the bribe from a 27-year-old complainant for helping by not arresting his family members in a case registered against them and the API assisted him in the crime, ACB officials said.

386.title: Taliban forces kill 6 Islamic State members in raid in Kabul
386.article_body: Taliban forces killed six Islamic State members in an overnight raid on their hideout in Afghanistan's capital, Kabul, a Taliban spokesperson said on Saturday. The slain Islamic State members were involved in two major attacks in recent weeks, one on a mosque near Kabul's former "Green Zone" and the other on a tutoring institute in the city, the spokesperson added.

387.title: Giorgia Meloni sworn in as Italy's 1st female Prime Minister
387.article_body: Giorgia Meloni was sworn in as Italy's first female Prime Minister at the presidential palace on Saturday. Meloni has been politically active since she was a teenage activist in a neo-fascist party's youth wing in Rome. In 2008, Meloni became Italy's youngest ever minister in Silvio Berlusconi's government.

388.title: Conway breaks Kohli's record for smashing highest T20I score by a visiting batter in Aus
388.article_body: New Zealand opener Devon Conway on Saturday broke Virat Kohli's record for smashing the highest T20I score by a visiting batter in Australia. Conway scored 92*(58) against Australia in their T20 World Cup 2022 Super 12 stage match in Sydney to break the record. Kohli had set the previous record by scoring 90*(55) against Australia in Adelaide in 2016.

389.title: Japan, Australia leaders sign new security pact amid China threat
389.article_body: Australian PM Anthony Albanese and his Japanese counterpart Fumio Kishida on Saturday signed a new bilateral security agreement amid China's growing military presence in the Asia-Pacific region. The two countries vowed to share more sensitive intelligence and conduct joint war games. "This landmark declaration sends a strong signal to the region of our strategic alignment," Albanese said.

390.title: Ex-UK PM Boris Johnson flies back from holiday to run for office
390.article_body: Former UK Prime Minister Boris Johnson, who was on holiday in the Caribbean, has flown back to Britain to run for office for the second time. This comes as his successor, Liz Truss, stepped down after serving for 45 days. Johnson received support of dozens of Conservative lawmakers but needs to secure 100 nominations to be considered for the race.

391.title: Balaji Telefilms' ex-COO who went missing may have been killed, claims Kenyan Prez's aide
391.article_body: An aide of Kenyan President William Ruto has claimed that the two missing Indians in Kenya have been killed by the disbanded DCI unit, a report said. Balaji Telefilms' ex-COO Zulfiqar Ahmad Khan and his friend Mohamed Zaid Sami Kidwai went missing alongside taxi driver Nicodemus Mwania in July. India has been in touch with Kenyan authorities on the matter.

392.title: Salman Khan recovering from dengue, to take a break from Bigg Boss 16: Report
392.article_body: Actor Salman Khan was diagnosed with dengue a few days ago and is currently on a break from his work commitments, as per reports. In his absence, Bigg Boss OTT host Karan Johar took over the weekend special episode of Bigg Boss 16. Salman is reportedly recovering and will soon get back to work.

393.title: Video of grand laser show in Ayodhya ahead of Diwali goes viral
393.article_body: A video of a grand laser show in UP's Ayodhya ahead of Diwali has gone viral on social media. The event was organised as part of the Deepotsav celebration, which Prime Minister Narendra Modi is set to visit on Sunday. During his visit, PM Modi will also conduct an inspection of the Shri Ram Janmabhoomi Teerth Kshetra's site.

394.title: Captaining is a big thing for me: Rohit ahead of India's T20 WC opener vs Pak
394.article_body: Asked about leading India ahead of their T20 World Cup 2022 opener against Pakistan, Rohit Sharma said, "Captaining is a big thing for me, but playing any game for India is important for me." He added, "Occasions keep changing. I've played...World Cup final once, against Pakistan in 2007." The T20 World Cup is Rohit's first World Cup as captain.

395.title: 4 killed, 3 injured after jeep crashes into pole in MP's Shajapur
395.article_body: Four people were killed and three injured after their speeding jeep crashed into a pole in Madhya Pradesh's Shajapur district, said police on Saturday. Four of the victims died on the spot, while the other three were admitted to a government hospital, said a police official. A probe into the incident has been initiated, added the official.

396.title: ₹1.10 cr hawala cash found in Chevrolet Spark car in Hyd, 4 arrested
396.article_body: Hyderabad Police found hawala cash worth over ₹1.10 crore in a Chevrolet Spark car and arrested four people for possessing unaccounted money on Thursday. The main accused, Kamlesh Kumar, is a resident of Chudibazar. Police said he had hatched a plan to run hawala business in and around Hyderabad as he wasn't getting enough profit from his plastic bag business.

397.title: 6-yr-old succumbs to burn injuries after Pune hotel catches fire
397.article_body: A six-year-old girl, Iqra Naeem Khan, died in a fire accident at a hotel near Bhikardas Maruti Temple in the Sadashiv Peth area of Pune. She was shifted to a private hospital, where she succumbed to the burn injuries. The cause of the fire and the extent of the damage have not been identified so far.

398.title: Feels nice to get praise for a rooted, regional film: Rishab on 'Kantara'
398.article_body: Rishab Shetty in an interview thanked Kangana Ranaut for praising his film 'Kantara'. He added that it "feels nice to get praise for a rooted, regional film". "This is the story of my village...It's being loved across the globe...People are talking...about our beliefs, tradition, culture, ritual, way of life," Rishab added. Kangana had said she was "shaking" after watching 'Kantara'.

399.title: Rishi Sunak is the only man for UK PM job: Kiran Mazumdar-Shaw
399.article_body: Biocon Limited's Executive Chairperson Kiran Mazumdar-Shaw has said that Indian-origin Rishi Sunak "is the only man for the (UK) PM job". Reacting to the front page of a British newspaper that said "Could Boris (Johnson) and Rishi unite to save Tories?", the billionaire suggested that only Sunak can help the Tories in the country's economic revival and political stability.

400.title: Zelenskyy urges West to warn Russia against blowing up hydro-electric dam
400.article_body: Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy has urged Western countries to warn Russia against blowing up Nova Kakhovka hydro-electric dam built on the Dnipro river. "Destroying the dam would mean a large-scale disaster," Zelenskyy said, calling it a new Russian terrorist attack. Russia has accused Kyiv of planning to destroy it. Neither of the countries produced any evidence supporting their claims.

401.title: 4 members of family killed in landslide in Uttarakhand's Chamoli
401.article_body: Four members of a family were killed when boulders fell on several houses after a landslide in Uttarakhand's Chamoli district at around 1 am on Saturday, said officials. The deceased included two women. According to Tharali SDM, five people were trapped under debris when the boulders fell. One of them is undergoing treatment at a hospital.
